visualization_prompt: Generate a spline chart showing monthly temperature variations in a temperate climate using synthetic data with seasonal trends and statistical noise.
visualization_explanation: The dataset represents a univariate time series with 12 monthly observations (categorical x-axis) and quantitative temperature measurements in °C. Synthetic data was generated using a sinusoidal base pattern (μ=15°C annual average) with ±8°C seasonal amplitude and ±2°C Gaussian noise to simulate realistic variability. The spline chart was chosen to emphasize the smooth seasonal transition while maximizing Tufte's data-ink ratio through axis simplification and removal of non-essential elements. Cairo's perceptual principles are applied through position encoding (temporal progression on x-axis) and magnitude encoding (temperature on y-axis), reinforced by a high-contrast color (#FF6347) for visual salience. The synthetic data maintains domain validity with summer peaks (25.6°C in July) and winter lows (4.8°C in January), mimicking mid-latitude climate patterns.
